bug.author: sezarxray
bug.summary: multi head multi loss model with GradientTape
bug.description:
Thank you for submitting a TensorFlow documentation issue. Per our GitHub policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests, and build/installation issues on GitHub. The TensorFlow docs are open source! To get involved, read the documentation contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
Please provide a link to the documentation entry, for example: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GradientTape>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/GradientTape</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
I have model with two head and two loss. I want to optimize my model in the way that each loss propagate separately in it's head branch.

comments.comment: This is not Build/Installation or Bug/Performance issue. Please post this kind of support questions at <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow>Stackoverflow</denchmark-link> . There is a big community to support and learn from your questions. GitHub is mainly for addressing bugs in installation and performance. Thanks!
